commit_message:
Add tests and param definitions for headers parameter

Cleanups for change I35c3b266b3c733f6b1629de4c683ea7d40128032

Add missing param definitions to client get_container
and head_object docstrings.

For consistency, add headers parameter to the Connection class
head_object and head_container wrapper methods.

Add tests to verify that the headers parameter of Connection
get_container, head_container and head_object methods is passed to the
module functions.

Change-Id: Ib40d5b626b2793840727c58cffbf725bea55651f

commit_message:
Make public the base loader classes

The loaders are a companion part to the authentication plugins that
assist in loading a specific plugin from options supplied via a config
file, command line arguments or other mechanisms.

The Base loaders handle the options that are common to a specific
identity authentication mechanism. They were added to the private
directory in the move from keystoneclient as they are only used by the
loaders defined in that directory and it gave us time to settle the
interfaces.

They are not expected to be private forever as they are expected to be
reused by anyone that is developing identity plugins outside of the
keystoneauth repository.

Closes-Bug: #1507423
Change-Id: I4b2fc321ae75e92509aacb15ac21e96880f2b20e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-10 03:46:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py'], 'message': 'Allow fip traffic between 2 VMs in a same host in a same nw

When VM1 without a fip, pings VM2 belonging to the same network
hosted in the same node using its fip, the reply from VM2 is
from its private ip.

This patch adds a iptables rule for each of the internal ports
attached to the dvr router so that the traffic of VM1 is snated
to its gateway ip (not the dvr snat ip) if the VM2 ip is dnated
to its fip.

Since both the VMs are in the same node, there is no real
reason for the traffic of VM1 to be directed to the
snat namespace of network node

Change-Id: I649a62c91ce37036a16d2ea69f345581960e7079
Closes-bug: #1462154
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow fip traffic between 2 VMs in a same host in a same nw

When VM1 without a fip, pings VM2 belonging to the same network
hosted in the same node using its fip, the reply from VM2 is
from its private ip.

This patch adds a iptables rule for each of the internal ports
attached to the dvr router so that the traffic of VM1 is snated
to its gateway ip (not the dvr snat ip) if the VM2 ip is dnated
to its fip.

Since both the VMs are in the same node, there is no real
reason for the traffic of VM1 to be directed to the
snat namespace of network node

Change-Id: I649a62c91ce37036a16d2ea69f345581960e7079
Closes-bug: #1462154

commit_message:
Create volume pre-select default vol-type

This change makes it so the create volume screen selects the default
volume type (instead of the "No Volume Type" as the default).

Change-Id: I0fd0993adb422701f00ecfdfc81c737b7d1db794
Closes-bug: #1493433

commit_message:
Fix missing *-replicator conf sections in deployment guide

The doc for these sections was missing because of an rst error - the
source is there in rst file but didn't make it into the html output.

Add doc for per_diff and max_diffs in account and container doc sections.

Also, fix a bunch of other sphinx build errors and most of the warnings.

Change-Id: If9ed2619b2f92c6c65a94f41d8819db8726d3893

commit_message:
Fix to enable_plugin to use branch param

The devstack enable_plugin function accepts only 3 parameters
but we are supplying 4 in the call in localrc.rc.  Need to remove
the $TROVE_DIR from the call which will then supply the 
proper parameters.

Change-Id: I6aa48ebf57d3df3e78d4c89860ef49febfec4a98
Closes-Bug: 1508552

commit_message:
Adds doc for backup service notifications

Added description in admin-guide-cloud for notifications sent
by the volume backup service to Ceilometer. Notifications
sent out for- create_backup, delete_backup,restore_backup and
progress notification to Swift backup service.

Change-Id: Idd8af4ec0103042ed8eb514d0b399693dc640d04
Closes-Bug: #1403202

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 16:36:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I8b884ef477bbc031da6bd3955ed308679e0380f6

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I8b884ef477bbc031da6bd3955ed308679e0380f6

commit_message:
Export the supported container and disk formats

This change allows users of the Glance API to know what formats are
supported. The formats are exported using a function to not give the
false impression that the list could be changed by the importer.

Change-Id: I39513b9f00bed0b9a05c01add842af537e3f1836

commit_message:
Format lists as comma separated strings for shell and table

When a user passes --format shell or table and the data contains a list the
list is not formatted resulting in output like:

foo="[1,2,3]"

This patches changes this to

foo="1,2,3"

Change-Id: Iea2ba80e4e66c218a39d8d640b3b58f8fc6ae5b6
Closes-bug: #1478995

commit_message:
Removing incorrect barbican setup in pre_test_hook

Removing special setup that we were doing for Barbican on the
devstack gate. Two reasons for this. First, the setup code has
drifted now that lib and extras.d dirs have been deprecated in
Devstack. Second, we are not using Barbian right now so there is
really no use of this setup. If and when we do decide to integrate
Barbican again, we can consider configuring the devstack gate with
any required Barbican setup.

Closes-Bug: #1512859

Change-Id: Id39dd9a08d4a813f0fb28a2c108d3820b46f49f9

commit_message:
Fix rabbit_userid parameter

A bug was introduced in [1], the lookup to find rabbitmq user was wrong.
This patch uses the right parameter again.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-trove/commit/86b7d23f298426ce3c84ea6c7ab9afb682dffa69

Change-Id: Ib23bde57f9a99707917525977d94da891e5a16dd

enabled.

subject: Revert 4096 byte-to-inode ratio
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 19:44:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Revert 4096 byte-to-inode ratio

This value of 4096 was introduced in 2013 with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25866/5

This causes images to have a very high FS overhead. The default
byte-to-inode ratio allows instances to fully utilize the advertised
space, so a "50GB Flavor" will launch an instance with 50GB usable

Change-Id: Ie80bbdb7a7aa3e7302e9c80a1196a7de2c799579
Closes-Bug: 1512841
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-03 20:44:45.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create'], 'message': 'Revert 4096 byte-to-inode ratio

This value of 4096 was introduced in 2013 with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25866/5

This causes images to have a very high FS overhead. The default
byte-to-inode ratio allows instances to fully utilize the advertised
space, so a "50GB Flavor" will launch an instance with 50GB usable

This only changes the MKFS_OPTS for vm images, which typically won't
be deployed past 10s of gigabytes.

Change-Id: Ie80bbdb7a7aa3e7302e9c80a1196a7de2c799579
Closes-Bug: 1512841
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Revert 4096 byte-to-inode ratio

This value of 4096 was introduced in 2013 with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25866/5

This causes images to have a very high FS overhead. The default
byte-to-inode ratio allows instances to fully utilize the advertised
space, so a "50GB Flavor" will launch an instance with 50GB usable

This only changes the MKFS_OPTS for vm images, which typically won't
be deployed past 10s of gigabytes.

Change-Id: Ie80bbdb7a7aa3e7302e9c80a1196a7de2c799579
Closes-Bug: 1512841

commit_message:
Add a tox target to run functional tests locally

Now 'tox -efunc' can be invoked to run all functional tests in
the 'venv' tox environment. Also `tox -efunc element-name` can be
used to run function tests for one element (e.g. ironic-agent).

[{'created': '2015-11-02 17:45:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adjust disk monitoring limits

This change increases the threshold limit for the corosync disk monitor
from 100M to 512M and decreases the disk monitoring interval from 30s to
15s. These changes are to try and provide additional time for pacemaker
to realize a full disk and trigger a failover prior to the disks
actually being filled.

With this change we are also reducing the disk_free_limit configuration
for rabbitmq from the default of 50M to 5M. When rabbitmq hits the
disk_free_limit, it will trigger flow control which will block the
clients. The reduction of the limit from 50M to 5M is to try and still
have the disk limit in place for an emergency situation but provide
additional time for corosync to try and shutdown rabbitmq before it
blocks clients.

DocImpact: Minimum space free set to 512M for a controller. If any
parition on the controller (besides /boot) drops below 512M, the
controller will migrate services off of the affected node. If space
drops below 5M prior to services being migrated, rabbitmq consumers may
be blocked and might have to be restored before services function
correctly.
Closes-Bug: #1493520

commit_message:
Adjust disk monitoring limits

This change increases the threshold limit for the corosync disk monitor
from 100M to 512M and decreases the disk monitoring interval from 30s to
15s. These changes are to try and provide additional time for pacemaker
to realize a full disk and trigger a failover prior to the disks
actually being filled.

With this change we are also reducing the disk_free_limit configuration
for rabbitmq from the default of 50M to 5M. When rabbitmq hits the
disk_free_limit, it will trigger flow control which will block the
clients. The reduction of the limit from 50M to 5M is to try and still
have the disk limit in place for an emergency situation but provide
additional time for corosync to try and shutdown rabbitmq before it
blocks clients.

DocImpact: Minimum space free set to 512M for a controller. If any
parition on the controller (besides /boot) drops below 512M, the
controller will migrate services off of the affected node. If space
drops below 5M prior to services being migrated, rabbitmq consumers may
be blocked and might have to be restarted before services function
correctly.
Closes-Bug: #1493520

Change-Id: I537543ce04c4f229939fd7836daf1d62c920974b

commit_message:
Add Keystone2Keystone auth plugin for K2K

Implement the auth plugin to be used for keystone to keystone
federation. Include enough new access object features to
ensure usage is the same as the related k2k plugin in
keystoneauth.

bp k2k-auth-plugin

Change-Id: I56b8990077ab9aac53835bcd9811daef1b0ffb5f

commit_message:
Updated quickstart doc

I merged "quickstart" doc with "ansible-deployment" and
"deploy-all-in-one-node". All three of them was covering same topic and
added a lot of confusion for new users.

I added some clarification lines from myself, with main goal to recive one
straightforward document for new users.

Change-Id: I793244c47ffbe0ba304e79bacf708494e59d99c4

commit_message:
Add qos_specs_id to volume type show

Adding qos_specs_id to the output of volume
type show to make getting the qos specs for
a volume type more convenient. However, this
variable will only be visible when type show
is called with the admin role.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Id8a2333267c9a51b36c6adfbd142dcc4fbe4f090
Closes-Bug: #1438488

subject: Remove default environment variable string
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-02 22:04:01.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': "Remove default environment variable string

When this function returns a '' for a nonexistent environment variable,
kwargs.get() calls never fall back to their default, which
causes get_system_ca_file to always be ignored.

Change-Id: Ied68f1d63fdd204ea32f9144443b1d07d70528bf
Closes-Bug: 1512495
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove default environment variable string

When this function returns a '' for a nonexistent environment variable,
kwargs.get() calls never fall back to their default, which
causes get_system_ca_file to always be ignored.

Change-Id: Ied68f1d63fdd204ea32f9144443b1d07d70528bf
Closes-Bug: 1512495

commit_message:
HNAS iSCSI manage does not work with spaces

Currently, HNAS iSCSI driver does not work when trying to manage a
volume that contains one or more space in the name.
This patch fixes this functionality and performs some other minor
adjustments.

Change-Id: I2ba6407478c293f20925171d80dcc8f97f2110c7
Closes-bug: #1500544
(cherry picked from commit 6bff01dbde949b4b391a4fae0abb94005f075143)

commit_message:
Implement update_migrated_volume for NFS driver

After the migration of an available volume to an NFS driver,
the back-end name can be renamed back to its original volume id
or name.

Change-Id: I2ef339f3a67088587199a1da825ec67529a9ec57
Closes-Bug: #1499151

commit_message:
Handle "No changes" in translation scripts

Some translation proposal jobs currently fail since there are no changes
since the previous run like
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/django_openstack_auth-propose-translation-update/32/console

Handle the situation to easily figure out real failures.

commit_message:
Job defined under congress instead of networking-bgpvpn

The gate-install-dsvm-networking-bgpvpn jobs has mistakenly been
moved from its right place (networking-bgpvpn) to the congress
project.

This change reverts the bogus rebase doen in
I983d3af9b40160c4bbfec683cd4eb17dd46ee1db.

commit_message:
make tempest.api.network.test_extensions.ExtensionsTestJSON pass

Tempest config of [networking-feature-enabled] api-extensions=all
by default. But ML2 plugin with odl driver doesn't support all of extension.
As the result, tempest.api.network.test_extensions.ExtensionsTestJSON fails.
This patch explicitly specifies supported extensions when it's not specified.

Closes-Bug: #1505470
Change-Id: I14eed02d2a9b348813edf6fc298a0d4a8bb37e99

commit_message:
puppet: do not run beaker for puppet-openstack_extras/kilo

pupppet-openstack_extras did not have acceptance* in stable/kilo.
We don't want to run functional testing on this branch, but rather
disable testing.

* https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack_extras/tree/stable/kilo/spec

Change-Id: Icdf03a88519e67779e90d45ea0ec14774ed2d5f2

commit_message:
Add methods for getting Session and Client objects

These come originally from the shade library, but are helpful for
things like the client libs themselves. Once one has a CloudConfig,
there is really one and only one correct way to get both a session
and a Client.

Change-Id: I1b4d4321828864fddab85a127fbf63f4c8384ab9

commit_message:
Add timeline view with Angular support.

This re-adds the Tempest timeline view as a set of Angular
directives. This includes related functionality, such as the Dstat
parser and some array utilities. The timeline view consists of
a timeline component, which includes the d3 chart, and a separate
details component, which shows additional information for tests
when selected in the timeline.

Change-Id: Ifaaeda91b0617e8cf7a60d30728005f5c8d00546

Fix broken unit tests

Recently we have included a new functionality that will help us
displaying percentage values in a much better way. The problem was that

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 16:30:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: If983dae0260ea2a1df49b4bdb0ada3c5223012c9
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-23 15:12:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: If983dae0260ea2a1df49b4bdb0ada3c5223012c9
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-10-27 03:20:46.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks

* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: If983dae0260ea2a1df49b4bdb0ada3c5223012c9
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: If983dae0260ea2a1df49b4bdb0ada3c5223012c9

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Ib909ebb74ece9d72d3b8c8ab5b7750cf3f1af09b

commit_message:
Use RequestSpec object in the FilterScheduler

Hydrate the RequestSpec object in the FilterScheduler and return the primitive
dictionaries before calling the filters so it isolates the changes only for
that module.
Next patches in the series will take this object and modify the southbound
methods.

Partially-Implements: blueprint request-spec-object-mitaka

Change-Id: I3872db59b6a70e124e34b9f0138c0b77a150c97c

commit_message:
Add etc to .gitignore

The following commit 8912cb89 causes the networking-ovn.ini file to
be autogenerated and placed in the top level etc of the networking-ovn
project which does not exist. This patch adds etc to .gitignore so I
can make sure I don't accidently add it to the repo.

Change-Id: Ia03e9b7f289afce665d3ac35ce2bbb33fec73911

commit_message:
Adds note about the LIBVIRT_VOL_POOL_TARGET used by create-nodes

Adds note about specifying an alternative for the libvirt default
storage pool location before instack-virt-setup - this depends on
a change in create-nodes @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/235278/

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 16:33:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I4a2926f2a80eab35a654400b1f451b5b8ee3e869

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I4a2926f2a80eab35a654400b1f451b5b8ee3e869

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I11607fcb400fab9b6096ca8af191c2f2f4b6eca9

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I80dd7e183098d7265ac52da4445c1963dace7ffb
(cherry picked from commit 09b2b5c70fa3772b33f4bce0ea178a723a820aab)

commit_message:
WIP: don't check for namespace existence

ensure_namespace appears to have an unnacceptable perfmance.
Let's stop using it in favor the pythonic approach of EAFP
rather than LBYL.[1] So instead of constantly checking if the
namespace exists, we just assume it does and catch errors
about it not existing as the create trigger.

1. https://docs.python.org/2/glossary.html#term-eafp
Related-Bug: #1497396

Change-Id: I4cd9c9ba41fb3a45e6c1b0720aae53e3955b6d18

commit_message:
Snapshot failure makes instance unusable

Not every private cloud deployment has the facility to opt for remote
storage. When using local storage, if the hypervisor does not have
enough storage space to store the snapshot, the instance might go into
unusable state. Protecting user data is one of the most important aspect
in providing better user experience.

Change-Id: I48b85944d24a89447700628c6e5946a26834f831

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I555bdeba198b1b468884ffce3702f5b06247d573

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I42fb3d11d65e261bd5fb0ccb757a68965699a693

subject: Moved CORS Middleware from application to paste.ini
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-19 16:05:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/server/wsgi.py', 'etc/keystone-paste.ini'], 'message': 'Moved CORS Middleware from application to paste.ini

This patch moves the CORS middleware from being explicitly
defined in the application bootstrap, to being declared via
paste.ini in the appropriate pipelines. The reason for this
is that some additional middleware - token_auth for instance,
can return the request before the CORS headers have a chance
to be evaluated. The result is that CORS only works if, and only
if, a request passes all middleware ahead of the application,
when it should function on every request.

This patch reverts, and replaces,
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216387

Change-Id: Idba82e3daca4c0134161c556d19dbaa2c09af9ee
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Moved CORS Middleware from application to paste.ini

This patch moves the CORS middleware from being explicitly
defined in the application bootstrap, to being declared via
paste.ini in the appropriate pipelines. The reason for this
is that some additional middleware - token_auth for instance,
can return the request before the CORS headers have a chance
to be evaluated. The result is that CORS only works if, and only
if, a request passes all middleware ahead of the application,
when it should function on every request.

This patch reverts, and replaces,
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216387

Change-Id: Idba82e3daca4c0134161c556d19dbaa2c09af9ee

commit_message:
Pass dhcp_gateway to cobbler::server class

dhcp_gateway was somehow defaulting back to $::ipaddress
instead of matching the values from fuel_settings.

This corrects the scenario where a custom dhcp_gateway
is configured, but not used.

Change-Id: I3d2bb485f30e6c7b8e103181b98b5139cc651ff0
Closes-Bug: #1512721

commit_message:
gemfile: Added netaddr package

netaddr dependency is required for change-id:
Iffb0af32753708decb8d2b60f1075b66f7520553,
netaddr works effectively with CIDR, subnetting and etc.

Change-Id: I802280e4e2912c9aed1c10d519ead84b1f22f900

commit_message:
Receiving of task processing confirmation from astute handled

We should know is task handled by orchestrator or not.
For instance, we should send stop_deployment task only if
provision or deploy tasks are handled by the orchestrator.
Task status 'pending' added into Task DB model and
handled in stop deployment, provisioning, deployment and
apply cluster changes task managers.

Nailgun Task object update function changed for bubble 'running'
status to parent task.

Locking of all cluster tasks calls removed for deadlocks
exclusion.

Consts used instead hardcoded tasks statuses in part of tests.

Co-Authored-By: Alexandra Morozova <astepanchuk@mirantis.com>
Depends-On: Ib054517696dc4e53487557b09b75ebfcb1255ecb
Depends-On: Idedb061b7b5c4dca4a0ca7adcaa570cecbb691af
Change-Id: I15ebeb85226c832923f9476bb91fa19c0ff87a4f
Closes-Bug: #1498827

subject: shotgun: skip offline nodes
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-19 17:35:46.000000000', 'files': ['shotgun/shotgun/config.py', 'shotgun/shotgun/driver.py'], 'message': "shotgun: skip offline nodes

Apparently, shotgun never tested which nodes are online
prior to execute snapshot method of objects. Therefore, for offline
nodes shotgun will then consume a lot of time waiting for connection
timeouts to be happened on per object basis.

This patch:
* adds nodes check to `config.py` in order to detect offline
  nodes prior of doing snapshot of objects related to them.
* adds `Offline` object driver. Being snapshotted, this object just
  creates a file with friendly reminder that particular node was
  offline inside of snapshot target directory. So, one which's
  looking at snapshot archive will effectively realize that node
  was offline without deep diving into shotgun log file.
* changes `objects` generator. For offline nodes it yeilds
  `Offline` object.

So, shotgun won't waste time or per object basis, as it was before.

Change-Id: Ib99476c7b67a04d4f472f3fa3803b3fb92d4fec4
Closes-Bug: #1397038
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
shotgun: skip offline nodes

Apparently, shotgun never tested which nodes are online
prior to execute snapshot method of objects. Therefore, for offline
nodes shotgun will then consume a lot of time waiting for connection
timeouts to be happened on per object basis.

This patch:
* adds nodes check to `config.py` in order to detect offline
  nodes prior of doing snapshot of objects related to them.
* adds `Offline` object driver. Being snapshotted, this object just
  creates a file with friendly reminder that particular node was
  offline inside of snapshot target directory. So, one which's
  looking at snapshot archive will effectively realize that node
  was offline without deep diving into shotgun log file.
* changes `objects` generator. For offline nodes it yeilds
  `Offline` object.

So, shotgun won't waste time or per object basis, as it was before.

Change-Id: Ib99476c7b67a04d4f472f3fa3803b3fb92d4fec4
Closes-Bug: #1397038

commit_message:
Just use direct requests/REST for extensions

The nova_client.client.get passthrough is a weird wrapper around REST
that is not requests, even though it is under the covers. However, we
have a keystoneauth Session, which can just make direct REST calls
against OpenStack endpoints. Turns out the REST API of OpenStack is not
nearly as bad as the client libs make it seem- so just make the call
directly.

Change-Id: If249df1585c9a89c43384b0096a7efd719239afd

commit_message:
Use json for in-tree cloud data

In preparation for sharing the default and vendor data with other
projects, potentially even non-python ones, move the data into json
format, which is slighly less exciting to read, but has more widespread
standard library support. The user-facing config file will still be in
yaml format, because that's easier on the eyes and it's expected to be
read and edited by humans.

Continue to accept yaml everywhere, because an end user may have dropped
a yaml config file into a dir somewhere, and that's fine.

Change-Id: I269d31e61da433ac20abb39acdde0f9f9fe12837

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 16:40:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Ibdb2ebccfd782ed5e01b7f0c4bfb6294c89232c6
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-23 15:14:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Ibdb2ebccfd782ed5e01b7f0c4bfb6294c89232c6

commit_message:
Make raw-requests calls behave like client calls

NovaGetUrl returns a tuple of response/body, but everything else returns
the actual object. If we're going to make raw calls, we should handle
them in such a way that the rest of the code doesn't konw the
difference. This also means that we have the opportunity to look at
response codes and throw exceptions if they aren't 200.

Change-Id: I0bab5056b5ba234f5509b56a716ce426e6a2c604

commit_message:
Move default values to $::os_service_default

This change updates the values that are currently defined but are the
service defaults to use the $::os_service_default fact.

The volume/ and backend/ values will be updated in a follow on patch.

Change-Id: I2a78f0966be5f18835b06be31d69e8c09e217b32

commit_message:
Update juno for new dev work - 2 Nov 2015

Updates all repo SHAs to open up work on 10.1.17

This patch also implements an appropriate cap for the elasticsearch
python low level client to match the version of elasticsearch used,
and implements a cap for elasticsearch-curator for the same reason.

As the caps have been implemented, there is no longer a need to carry
the git sources too, so they've been removed.

The changes for elasticsearch were implemented as the latest versions
were being pulled in by the installation, causing problems with juno
build requirements and also causing the elasticsearch installation to
fail entirely.

Change-Id: Ia878d14c9f50869654aa2874e514930cec54e58f

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Depends-On: I228683aea1a8def46eaac63704e41617ba892438
Change-Id: Ie8f0709bf360d9c4af2559b3278f26cd2cb191f5

commit_message:
Sending confirmation to Nailgun on task dispatching

We need to know is task handled by orchestrator in the Nailgun
or not. For instance we shouldn't send stop task, if provsion or
deploy tasks not handled by the orchestrator.

Change-Id: Ib054517696dc4e53487557b09b75ebfcb1255ecb
Partial-Bug: #1498827

commit_message:
Add wait for active image status

To be sure that image is ready to create volume with it,
add wait for image status.
Also make image public and set name to it.

Closes-Bug: #1507987

Change-Id: Ibb87e692a2b0ee36d220d107e2ae9ba500485eab

commit_message:
Special case pbr's repository for d-g neutron job

gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-{name} naively assumes that all
repositories under test are under the openstack/ namespace. This is
incorrect, since pbr is the odd special snowflake. Special case its
repository location in the job.

Change-Id: I974c2c53a77ff092abda28eea8564e5ca3b14de3
Co-Authored-By: Sachi King <nakato@nakato.io>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-20 13:36:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "rootwrap: update ln --symbolic filter for FS and FC type volume drivers

Cinder change I03f8cae05cc117e14f7482115de685fc9f3fa54a sets the
'encrypted' key for all cinder volume drivers connection_info. When run
through the encrypted volume tests in Tempest, this hits the encryption
providers in Nova that fail for certain types of volume drivers, like
file system and fibre channel, due to the rootwrap filter not matching.

This change updates the symbolic link rootwrap filter so it works with
file system and fibre channel type volume backends rather than just
iSCSI.

The /dev/mapper/ prefix is always set in the encryptor modules, so that
can remain as before.

The symbolic link path is a complete wildcard, however, because the file
system volume backends all have a configurable option for the mount path
prefix, which defaults to $state_path/mnt but may not be that value.

An example call for NFS:

ln --symbolic --force \
/dev/mapper/volume-f5684ecc-959f-4de8-8d62-a8adf4bdb4cc \
/opt/stack/data/nova/mnt/21dd48babac42ae884d1192b8697a041/\
volume-f5684ecc-959f-4de8-8d62-a8adf4bdb4cc

An example call for fibre channel:

ln --symbolic --force \
/dev/mapper/pci-0000:06:00.0-fc-0x5006016508603f9f-lun-151 \
/dev/disk/by-path/pci-0000:06:00.0-fc-0x5006016508603f9f-lun-151

This change also updates the sg_info and sgscan entries to reference the
correct module since those are not called from nova.virt.libvirt.volume
anymore.

Closes-Bug: #1470142
Related-Bug: #1440227

Change-Id: I181b594a3119f7ad74c595fc7059d521079b1d74
(cherry picked from commit 0facd1f89edfd88188662e0cac274a136a424c3d)
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-29 11:25:05.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters'], 'message': "rootwrap: update ln --symbolic filter for FS and FC type volume drivers

Cinder change I03f8cae05cc117e14f7482115de685fc9f3fa54a sets the
'encrypted' key for all cinder volume drivers connection_info. When run
through the encrypted volume tests in Tempest, this hits the encryption
providers in Nova that fail for certain types of volume drivers, like
file system and fibre channel, due to the rootwrap filter not matching.

This change updates the symbolic link rootwrap filter so it works with
file system and fibre channel type volume backends rather than just
iSCSI.

The /dev/mapper/ prefix is always set in the encryptor modules, so that
can remain as before.

The symbolic link path is a complete wildcard, however, because the file
system volume backends all have a configurable option for the mount path
prefix, which defaults to $state_path/mnt but may not be that value.

An example call for NFS:

ln --symbolic --force \
/dev/mapper/volume-f5684ecc-959f-4de8-8d62-a8adf4bdb4cc \
/opt/stack/data/nova/mnt/21dd48babac42ae884d1192b8697a041/\
volume-f5684ecc-959f-4de8-8d62-a8adf4bdb4cc

An example call for fibre channel:

ln --symbolic --force \
/dev/mapper/pci-0000:06:00.0-fc-0x5006016508603f9f-lun-151 \
/dev/disk/by-path/pci-0000:06:00.0-fc-0x5006016508603f9f-lun-151

This change also updates the sg_info and sgscan entries to reference the
correct module since those are not called from nova.virt.libvirt.volume
anymore.

Note(lyarwood): This is also present in stable/kilo when the ISERDriver
is used as the encrypted key is correctly set by the parent ISCSIDriver.
As with NFS and FC in Liberty the current rootwrap filters do not allow
the encryption providers within Nova to call ln against the resulting
iSER device paths. For example (shortened to fit within this message):

ln --symbolic --force \
/dev/mapper/pci-*-ip-*-iscsi-*:volume-*-lun-* \
/dev/disk/by-path/pci-*-ip-*-iscsi-*:volume-*-lun-*

Closes-Bug: #1470142
Related-Bug: #1440227

Change-Id: I181b594a3119f7ad74c595fc7059d521079b1d74
(cherry picked from commit 0facd1f89edfd88188662e0cac274a136a424c3d)
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
rootwrap: update ln --symbolic filter for FS and FC type volume drivers

Cinder change I03f8cae05cc117e14f7482115de685fc9f3fa54a sets the
'encrypted' key for all cinder volume drivers connection_info. When run
through the encrypted volume tests in Tempest, this hits the encryption
providers in Nova that fail for certain types of volume drivers, like
file system and fibre channel, due to the rootwrap filter not matching.

This change updates the symbolic link rootwrap filter so it works with
file system and fibre channel type volume backends rather than just
iSCSI.

The /dev/mapper/ prefix is always set in the encryptor modules, so that
can remain as before.

The symbolic link path is a complete wildcard, however, because the file
system volume backends all have a configurable option for the mount path
prefix, which defaults to $state_path/mnt but may not be that value.

An example call for NFS:

ln --symbolic --force \
/dev/mapper/volume-f5684ecc-959f-4de8-8d62-a8adf4bdb4cc \
/opt/stack/data/nova/mnt/21dd48babac42ae884d1192b8697a041/\
volume-f5684ecc-959f-4de8-8d62-a8adf4bdb4cc

An example call for fibre channel:

ln --symbolic --force \
/dev/mapper/pci-0000:06:00.0-fc-0x5006016508603f9f-lun-151 \
/dev/disk/by-path/pci-0000:06:00.0-fc-0x5006016508603f9f-lun-151

This change also updates the sg_info and sgscan entries to reference the
correct module since those are not called from nova.virt.libvirt.volume
anymore.

Note(lyarwood): This is also present in stable/kilo when the ISERDriver
is used as the encrypted key is correctly set by the parent ISCSIDriver.
As with NFS and FC in Liberty the current rootwrap filters do not allow
the encryption providers within Nova to call ln against the resulting
iSER device paths. For example (shortened to fit within this message):

ln --symbolic --force \
/dev/mapper/pci-*-ip-*-iscsi-*:volume-*-lun-* \
/dev/disk/by-path/pci-*-ip-*-iscsi-*:volume-*-lun-*

Closes-Bug: #1470142
Related-Bug: #1440227

Change-Id: I181b594a3119f7ad74c595fc7059d521079b1d74
(cherry picked from commit 0facd1f89edfd88188662e0cac274a136a424c3d)

commit_message:
Fix path to the mcollective-only Puppet manifest

As part of the move to puppet-community/mcollective module,
mcollective-server-only.pp has been moved to nailgun module
and renamed to mcollective-only.pp.

Related-bug: 1508058
Change-Id: I26ac4110e1e2abd9ea2caa4954958a161dc5e204

commit_message:
Add tox.ini with pep8 tests to fix CI

* Add tox.ini with pep8 tests so 'gate-fuel-web-pep8' is able to
  actually run
* Ignore all existing pep8 errors and warnings to unblock merging in
  stable/5.0, but prevent any more pep8 errors and warnings
* Add .tox to .gitignore

Change-Id: Iad59da7f8e5af901e7c9fa830f3a6ebe81d021b3
Related-Bug: #1511787

commit_message:
Change openstack-network anchor task to type skipped

This task was running hiera task after neutron tasks
were completed, causing hiera metadata to modify
mid-deployment. This was breaking deployments with
plugins, which write to /etc/hiera.yaml. Hiera task
overwrites this file, causing a discrepancy during
deployment and breaking rabbitmq dump definitions
task.

Change-Id: Ie5a0715e468888cb8359b746f220099c04f01af2
Closes-Bug: #1512017

commit_message:
Add possibility to run tempest plugin tests

This patch add possibility to devstack-gate to run
tests from tempest plugin interfaces, which may installed by non-core
components (e.g. manila, murano, congress, etc..)
Add a global variable, which responsible for running
tox -e all-plugin command in tempest project.

Change-Id: Ibb79cedc044571c282733657e3e60f460a04487b

commit_message:
Update task types to current nailgun task schema

Added skipped and reboot task types to tasklib schema
to match what is valid for Fuel 7.0 and 8.0. The schemas
are the same for both releases, and as such, they have been
added as new schema types for tasklib.

Change-Id: Iace451be899b7aa10534502a003e2085e0ac16ae
Closes-Bug: #1512639

commit_message:
Add fuel-tasklib to fuel library using tox

This project was deprecated out of stackforge and
needs a home in fuel-library, where it current is used
as a testing library.

Tox is used so it can call tasks-test-requirements.txt
with relative paths correctly. Otherwise, the relative
path would have to be guessed based on where a user
might call it.

Change-Id: I742e167a77cca2ae47436cce7b1baf63e70fe063
Closes-Bug: #1507208

was fixed in another bug.

of server's booting.

commit_message:
Provide reversal of vioses for migration

When the migration WWPNs are built, the VIOS wrappers needs to be
reversed, like during a normal deploy.  This change enables this.

It also removes some optimization code that is no longer needed due to
switching to the FeedTask model.

Change-Id: Ia66df870473e6cee34c6a1fa1b39dbb771b6790a
(cherry picked from commit 0b68d3a07909027bbb7a5862fb4f6daded6eb0a2)

subject: Remove duplicate call to _get_allowed_mac_addresses_from_port()
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-02 23:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/plugin.py'], 'message': "Remove duplicate call to _get_allowed_mac_addresses_from_port()

Previously, the update_port() code was making an extra call to
_get_allowed_mac_addresses() which wasn't needed. This patch most
likely also fixes a bug that that would occur if the port was a

commit_message:
Remove duplicate call to _get_allowed_mac_addresses_from_port()

Previously, the update_port() code was making an extra call to
_get_allowed_mac_addresses() which wasn't needed. This patch most
likely also fixes a bug that that would occur if the port was a
vtep as the code expected allowed_macs to be [].

Change-Id: I5d7661e92c5ad2477640d17e6bfaef347e47835a

commit_message:
Enable spaced-comment

Some style guides require or disallow a whitespace immediately
after the initial // or /* of a comment. Whitespace after the
// or /* makes it easier to read text in comments. On the other
hand, commenting out code is easier without having to put a
whitespace right after the // or /*.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/spaced-comment

Change-Id: If223d80f3433045694f86f6e491667b26dd733ff

get_updater_info, and get_auditor_info.

Added tests for get_device_info and get_swift_conf_md5.

commit_message:
Restrict direct connections to Nova API

Allow direct connections from management network only.
All other connections are terminated by HA-Proxy with SSL.

Change-Id: Ia168ee16c40a9ee6937de4633fce798fffcb4217
Closes-bug: #1501737

commit_message:
Get valid server state

When a compute service fails, the states of the hosted VMs are not
updated. This means Nova may return incorrect information. Compounding
this, normal users don't have access to the service list or even
know which host their VM is on, so they have no way to know that
Nova may give them outdated information. Also there is no indication
about maintenance.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I1fc1cd02f8d755e3c53153936e1440f592bbe2d1
Implements: blueprint get-valid-server-state

commit_message:
Add helper method  _update_port_in_ovn()

This patch pulls out ovn related code in update_port() to it's own helper
method _update_port_in_ovn(). This helps make the code more readable and
matches the same pattern used in create_port/_create_port_in_ovn.

Change-Id: I50e197f7a3bf38089e13501298692477f603b070

commit_message:
Pull out ovn config options to helper method

This patch creates a new method _get_ovn_port_options to reduce duplicate
code in create/update_port().

Change-Id: I1221e4a941f5836ca573f0357f500e13100b0b4f

commit_message:
Move CloneableVD to common functions

Since every driver implements the functions needed by CloneableVD
we can move it to BaseVD.

Change-Id: I3ce24f9950bfa54c8dc19835f0e19f4c3c5181c8

commit_message:
A better create server example

It's much more straight-forward for users to read a create server
example that does everything necessary to create the server
within the body of a single method. In this better example the user
doesn't have to refer to other examples to learn how to create a
server.

Change-Id: Iad7eef7946e93deb735fddcfbe39bbc8b56f507b

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-31 11:32:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add UTF-8 coding lines to add Python files

While not strictly necessary for files containing only ASCII
characters, adding a line with "coding: utf-8" can guard against
future SyntaxError's in case someone inserts a Unicode literal.

This commit adds such lines to all .py files. The syntax used by this
commit works with Python (of course). It also works with Emacs, which
will recognize the special "-*-" marker and use the "coding" variable
to correctly decode the file, even in an environment where UTF-8 is
not the default file encoding.

Existing coding lines were normalized to match the new lines added.

Closes-bug: #1325193
Change-Id: Ie17bb98477eac08eb6bb8874747fedf1d53da650

commit_message:
Add UTF-8 coding lines to all Python files

While not strictly necessary for files containing only ASCII
characters, adding a line with "coding: utf-8" can guard against
future SyntaxError's in case someone inserts a Unicode literal.

This commit adds such lines to all .py files. The syntax used by this
commit works with Python (of course). It also works with Emacs, which
will recognize the special "-*-" marker and use the "coding" variable
to correctly decode the file, even in an environment where UTF-8 is
not the default file encoding.

Existing coding lines were normalized to match the new lines added.

Closes-bug: #1325193
Change-Id: Ie17bb98477eac08eb6bb8874747fedf1d53da650

commit_message:
Remove LXC references from manifests and dockerctl

Docker doesn't use LXC as a backend since 0.9 version that has been
released in March 2014.

Change-Id: Iac8b07f956fac95b977b2adda75717d8649f8b97
Closes-bug: 1510541

commit_message:
Provide reversal of vioses for migration

When the migration WWPNs are built, the VIOS wrappers needs to be
reversed, like during a normal deploy.  This change enables this.

It also removes some optimization code that is no longer needed due to
switching to the FeedTask model.

Change-Id: Ia66df870473e6cee34c6a1fa1b39dbb771b6790a

commit_message:
Sort and filter environment nodes by node network group

* added support of node network group sorter and filter
  for environment node list
* node network name is shown in node pop-up

Related to blueprint node-groups-in-sorters-and-filters

Change-Id: I6bc3de6c9bfa8bd9fe73415ac2d54b4ea2eebcd0

commit_message:
Use stevedore aliases for interface_driver configuration

interface_driver configuration was updated to use stevedore aliases.
This patch is to change devstack scripts to now use the aliases
instead of the previous class imports.

Closes-Bug: #1504536

Change-Id: Ic56bfcc1f9da05a999e6fd328e4dd6617e9470ff

commit_message:
Adds nova show and nova console output plugins

Nova provides show and console output functionalities for a server.
Currently, there isn't a benchmark provided by rally that does the above.

This commit adds plugins that call nova client's get and get console output
methods for a given server, allowing to use those for benchmarking.

This patch also includes functional and unit tests for newly added plugins.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Stolarczyk <zerodivisible@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ica8642ca8463b1bcba936e3c1d392b4588a56dc2

commit_message:
Added kafka interaction objects to monasca_common

New consumer object intended to be used by the pieces of Monasca that want to
consume data from kafka.

New producer object that will write to kafka in a performant manner.

Require kazoo
Removed PyYaml requirement

Change-Id: I2eb0c5cd1ed64b83a67912109c4c6de7a1d73722

commit_message:
Consolidate and improve hierarchy of loading of settings

The default settings.yaml should take lowest priority,
then /etc/fuel/astute.yaml, then custom module-specific
sources for settings (such as parsing resolv.conf).

Implemented deep merging of dicts so that keys not present
in astute.yaml, but are present in settings.yaml, are used.

Added test for utils.py
Added dhcp_gateway default to settings.yaml

Change-Id: I77d479833132e5eedca55d8b2ffe7a1b01123e1d
Closes-Bug: #1510156

commit_message:
Add restrictions for network groups

This change introduces new field 'restrictions' for networks

On cluster create and on attributes update, network metadata validates
restrictions if specified.

Networks with restrictions should be created or removed depends on cluster
attributes matches specified restrictions.

Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)
Change-Id: I65a0d27e7c4c95360d4745f7e9cdd948bb20fdd3

subject: force measurement value to type float before writing to db
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-02 18:30:52.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_persister/persister.py'], 'message': 'force measurement value to type float before writing to db

whole number values (such as 0) are json decoded as type int
If the value field is first written to InfluxDB as type int (example: 0)
and later as type float (example 0.123), InfluxDB throws a
"field type conflict" exception. Forcing all data to type float fixes.

Change-Id: Ifc139bbc67077137501ffe9045a988b8afc393e4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
force measurement value to type float before writing to db

whole number values (such as 0) are json decoded as type int
If the value field is first written to InfluxDB as type int (example: 0)
and later as type float (example 0.123), InfluxDB throws a
"field type conflict" exception. Forcing all data to type float fixes.

Change-Id: Ifc139bbc67077137501ffe9045a988b8afc393e4

"Metric" object in those places.

commit_message:
Creation a list of samples in sample generator

In previous version of sample generator samples were created one per
request. Because of ceilometer api has possibility to processing
requests with array of samples it will be good to use it to speed
up samples creation.

In this patch were added changes for sample generator. Now samples
that intended for one resource are placed to one request as list of
samples. It must speed up samples creation.

Co-Authored-By: Igor Degtiarov <idegtiarov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I1ae300aa1de2c41dde3890db5b0c98519a09eaf1

subject: VFC Migration mapping string vios reversal
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 14:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/npiv.py'], 'message': 'VFC Migration mapping string vios reversal

In the case of multiple fabrics with dual vioses, VFC mapping
strings should build mapping across both the VIOSes. So we
need to reverse the vios wraps in order to use the second vios
for the next fabric.

Change-Id: I09d9bd65241195247b326c8afdb54501fd6e4ed9
(cherry picked from commit 0800820fc909fa5ce273bb4ed881225681f9db40)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VFC Migration mapping string vios reversal

In the case of multiple fabrics with dual vioses, VFC mapping
strings should build mapping across both the VIOSes. So we
need to reverse the vios wraps in order to use the second vios
for the next fabric.

Change-Id: I09d9bd65241195247b326c8afdb54501fd6e4ed9
(cherry picked from commit 0800820fc909fa5ce273bb4ed881225681f9db40)

nova.conf: fix incorrect neutron credentials.

Nova should use Neutron credentials to interact with Neutron.

Backport: liberty
Closes-Bug: #1512070

(cherry picked from commit b072ea9c3dfacaad812785d910c36133c405a13f)

commit_message:
Prevent virbr0 from being created by default

Small change to remove the default network since neutron handles all
of the bridge and veth creation. virbr0 becomes clutter.

CentOS doesn't seem to come with this default.xml network, so no
change there.

Note: This doesn't remove virbr0 from a running system, it only
prevents its creation.

Change-Id: I8e118ea285c674a47884bbe864df134133406bbc
Closes-Bug: #1512060
Potential-Backport: Liberty

subject: VFC Migration mapping string vios reversal
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 12:54:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/npiv.py'], 'message': 'VFC Migration mapping string vios reversal

In the case of multiple fabrics with dual vioses, VFC mapping
strings should build mapping across both the VIOSes. So we
need to reverse the vios wraps in order to use the second vios
for the next fabric.

Change-Id: I09d9bd65241195247b326c8afdb54501fd6e4ed9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VFC Migration mapping string vios reversal

In the case of multiple fabrics with dual vioses, VFC mapping
strings should build mapping across both the VIOSes. So we
need to reverse the vios wraps in order to use the second vios
for the next fabric.

Change-Id: I09d9bd65241195247b326c8afdb54501fd6e4ed9

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 02:09:12.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34
we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch
puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem
to happen.
Closes-bug: #1489059
Change-Id: I457bd97b8e34c71300abbf909d459e5583e46927
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34
we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch
puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem
to happen.
Closes-bug: #1489059
Change-Id: I457bd97b8e34c71300abbf909d459e5583e46927

Sometimes, the count value provided in action input could be string
rather than integer. In that case, we should convert it first
before calculating scaling adjustment in scaling policy.

Change-Id: Ide708fcaa63ad9133f52693484e1f5861be777d3
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Convert count value into integer in scaling policy

Sometimes, the count value provided in action input could be string
rather than integer. In that case, we should convert it first
before calculating scaling adjustment in scaling policy.

Change-Id: Ide708fcaa63ad9133f52693484e1f5861be777d3

commit_message:
Update devref to catchup with libnetwork 0.5.0

Updating devref to address following changes:
1. Removal of 'service' from docker
2. Vendoring in IPAM driver support from libnetwork to docker. This
allows user to pass subnet of their choice using docker cli. In case
if user does not provide subnet related configuration and neither
remote ipam driver while creating network, built-in ipam driver will
provide default subnet configuration.

refer to the links for details:
https://github.com/docker/docker/pull/16645
https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/blob/master/docs/ipam.md

Change-Id: I30f5cb54d4feadafc954f6e4b09bcbd6243e6c00
Closes-Bug: #1505489

commit_message:
Per-branch HEAD files for conflict management

We have pep8 check for validation revisions, but it allows
outdated changes go into merge queue. To prevent this added
CONTRACT_HEAD, EXPAND_HEAD files.

Closes-bug: #1505701

Change-Id: Ie4b727e55a0b1ecb12e915a0037094a928d8f975

commit_message:
Drop types module usage

Since python 2.2, use of types module is not prefered way to
access the type hence it is replaced by using names of built-in
factory functions.

Change-Id: Ibdcc1ae75204f67076edab5edcffe94a9f1f1d8e
Implements: blueprint replace-types-module-with-new-style-classes

commit_message:
Move policy detach from action to cluster

This patch moves the policy-detach logic from action to cluster module.
The intent is to simplify the action module while making the operation a
method of the cluster. This logic now can be reused in other context
with a constraint that the cluster must be locked first.

Change-Id: Id0139769e6600d45eac93e37c938c06e0aecfde8

commit_message:
Docs: clarify that AnySubnetRequest is optional

The phrasing of "may not support" was a little confusing, mostly because
I read it as an imperative - "you may not do this" instead of it
being "you can do this if you want"

commit_message:
Support for oslo.messaging pika driver for RabbitMQ

Oslo team is writing a new driver for RabbitMQ using
the pika library. We'll need to support switching
between the existing kombu library and the new pika
library based as well to be able to develop and
trouble shoot the new driver. This patch makes it
configurable.

Change-Id: Ie3cb4c2c9868d0c859f1a8dccde44df6f69ceb81
Depends-On: I7bda78820e657b1e97bf888d4065a917eb317cfb
Implements: blueprint configurable-rpc-backend
Implements: blueprint rabbit-pika

commit_message:
Create keystone roles and admin user from t-h-t manifests

Currently keystone initialization happens via os-cloud-config [1].

This commit moves some of that directly into the manifests. This is the
first in a series of two changes to migrate it entirely into t-h-t.

This change focus on implementing what keystone.initialize() was doing
on the tripleoclient [2], creates the admin tenant, user and roles.

It also creates the keystone endpoint itself.

1.  https://github.com/openstack/os-cloud-config/blob/master/os_cloud_config/keystone.py#L128-L158
2.  https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/master/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py#L462-L527

Change-Id: I98555b707ff9b91c6e218de5dca68106ea05c8ea
Depends-On: Ia4b3244f114dcff746ab89d355ad4933f8fdbddf

Drivers that report no value for the "compression" common capability

commit_message:
Use 'False' as default value for "compression" common capability

Drivers that report no value for the "compression" common capability
should be treated in the scheduler as if compression=False.

Change-Id: I60ebfd24f623ec3da081e48afa39cc5c2fee52b0
Closes-Bug: #1504746
(cherry picked from commit 57a6a6535e97233fc84f2d1e744e502792f9dfd9)

Add subunit.log to gitignore

Execute the run_test.sh, it will generate a subunit.log file,
So add it to the gitignore file

commit_message:
Put fuelclient configuration file in root's $HOME

System-wide fuelclient configuration has been deprecated.

Related-Bug: 1458361
Co-authored-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
Co-authored-by: Bartłomiej Piotrowski <bpiotrowski@mirantis.com>
Depends-on: Ia17c8edbdd71a74318d3237a47d4b5650934c378
Change-Id: I08fd7bf965af1552d16671636c4f706c5a2d6a11

commit_message:
Added MAINTAINERS to top-level repo directory

In a consensus reached in a proposal for code review process
change [1], and proposed team structure policy document [2],
adding MAINTAINERS files in repositories.

Please note, that this file is written in YAML format in order
to allow further automation around code review process.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/072406.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225376/

Fuel-CI: disable

Change-Id: I0090fb3f9bac3a15a28dc11671e8dce0edc2a94b
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

Add subunit.log to gitignore

So add it to the gitignore file

commit_message:
[WIP] do_mkbootstrap

Split do_build_image
Initial commit for nailgun:do_mkbootstrap :
 New entry point, wich add possibility to build
 custom bootstrap image,based on ubuntu-trusty.

Implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap
Related-Bug: #1444090
Change-Id: I0ea7da105c662940618fd1c120e75d491db9914f

for tasks ready for sending or already sent to astute, but not
acknoledged by astute. After task is acknoledged by astute it

commit_message:
Task status 'pending' handled in tests

Status 'pending' introduced for proper tasks as intermediate status
for tasks ready for sending or already sent to astute, but not
acknoledged by astute. After task is acknoledged by astute it
changes status to 'running'.

Change-Id: Idedb061b7b5c4dca4a0ca7adcaa570cecbb691af
Partial-Bug: #1498827

commit_message:
Produce an error when extra arguments are present

Currently `parse_known_args` method is used which does not produce an
error when extra arguments are present. In this patch `parse_args` is
used which produces an error when extra arguments are present.

Change-Id: Iefbf221d912cce2b2af536f471c89f4a7a49693d
Closes-Bug: #1460572
Closes-Bug: #1496967

commit_message:
Dynamic dnsmasq for fuelweb_admin networks

Install 'daemonize' package in mcollective container for puppet
mcollective agent. Also configure Hiera inside mcollective container.

We need this for puppet task which is being executed in 'mcollective'
container and which updates dnsmasq dhcp ip ranges when we change
fuelweb_admin networks in any nodegroup.

Co-Authored-By: Aleksandr Didenko <adidenko@mirantis.com>

Blueprint: dynamic-dnsmasq
Partial-bug: #1495593

Change-Id: I3309b32e3ede4be2f6758ff756b4ed15e3b20d66

commit_message:
Revert "Move user-defined extra networks from dnsmasq.template to astute"

This reverts commit b59f69257b043212522b3c4fff946bd68068879a.

We're implementing automatic configuration of DHCP ranges in
dnsmasq so this workaround is no longer needed.

Co-Authored-By: Aleksandr Didenko <adidenko@mirantis.com>
Blueprint: dynamic-dnsmasq

subject: Adds LIBVIRT_VOL_POOL_TARGET to tripleo create-nodes
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-15 11:50:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adds LIBVIRT_VOL_POOL_TARGET to tripleo create-nodes

During dev setup in a vm environment, the default OS partitioning
may result in insufficient space for the libvirt default storage
pool which defaults (and we also hard-code) to
/var/lib/libvirt/images

This simple change means you can export LIBVIRT_VOL_POOL_TARGET
before instack-virt-setup to get the libvirt default storage pool
created there (and the directory is created if necessary).

Change-Id: I85d51457fbd8b747f55091f3ecdc6ca921b70b84
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-22 11:47:35.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/create-nodes'], 'message': 'Adds LIBVIRT_VOL_POOL_TARGET to tripleo create-nodes

During dev setup in a vm environment, the default OS partitioning
may result in insufficient space for the libvirt default storage
pool which defaults (and we also hard-code) to
/var/lib/libvirt/images

This change means you can export LIBVIRT_VOL_POOL_TARGET
before instack-virt-setup to get the libvirt default storage pool

', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Adds LIBVIRT_VOL_POOL_TARGET to tripleo create-nodes

During dev setup in a vm environment, the default OS partitioning
may result in insufficient space for the libvirt default storage
pool which defaults (and we also hard-code) to
/var/lib/libvirt/images

This change means you can export LIBVIRT_VOL_POOL_TARGET
before instack-virt-setup to get the libvirt default storage pool
created there (and the directory is created if necessary).

Change-Id: I85d51457fbd8b747f55091f3ecdc6ca921b70b84

commit_message:
Tidy up docs - fixup missing links to TOC where possible

Due to layout of current docs, some sections don't display the TOC
on the left hand navbar, for example installation/installation.html

One of the reasons is that the subsections there (installing or
updating) are labelled as sections (=== instead of ----).

This updates the installation and troubleshooting sections

Change-Id: Iad8f9fd760716c3f7139684861b12e2cd286501a

commit_message:
CentOS 7: enable network interfaces by default

CentOS 7 has network interfaces disabled by default, using ONBOOT=no configuration parameter for interfaces,
in contrast to the CentOS 6.x default behavior. Due to keep compatibility with the expectations, lets enable
the interfaces.

The other difference is migration to systemd. The script rc.local using for form the /etc/issue should be called
on boot. Corresponding systemd service rc-local.service is called when the /etc/rc.local is executable.
Since the /etc/rc.local file and access rights are changed in the kick-start file, nothing should be done here.

Change-Id: Iccda83f35c0306cefe12e468a73fff4d1aa49f5e
Closes-bug: #1507896

commit_message:
Include all yaml files in MANIFEST.in

In Debian, the package misses all yaml files. This patch
fixes the situation by adding a recursive-include.

Change-Id: I3ba4126fe83e03bbfb9aa521b49ef042b200b55c

commit_message:
Install compute node on Debian

This patch removes unecessary manual steps, as most of them
are already the default value stored in the default nova.conf
in Debian.

commit_message:
Makes configuration files more standard

In Debian, there's a system to configure the Keystone auth token,
the rabbitmq connection and the database. If you don't know about
it, please read the doc over here:
http://docs.openstack.org/juno/install-guide/install/apt-debian/content/ch_debconf.html

This patch indends to:
- Make the configuration files parseable by Debian's config and postinst
scripts (so that Debconf can be used)
- Make it more "OpenStack standard"

Change-Id: If8607f5071d02965307a1d5b021878cc36637d5e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-23 08:51:48.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': 'Also install alembic migration files

Doing a normal "python setup.py install" doesn't get all the files
installed by default: the files in manila/db/migrations/alembic aren't
included.

In Debian, we have to carry a patch to make all the files from the
alembic migrations folder installed properly. Please add this patch
to the trunk of Manila, so that we don't have to carry it at the
distribution level.

Change-Id: Ic31f426059a2ecb7824833b6ea559ab79fc99ad4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Also install alembic migration files

Doing a normal "python setup.py install" doesn't get all the files
installed by default: the files in manila/db/migrations/alembic aren't
included.

In Debian, we have to carry a patch to make all the files from the
alembic migrations folder installed properly. Please add this patch
to the trunk of Manila, so that we don't have to carry it at the
distribution level.

Change-Id: Ic31f426059a2ecb7824833b6ea559ab79fc99ad4

commit_message:
Bump ceilometerclient to 1.4.0

If using something lower than 1.4.0, heat just fails to
pass unit tests. I experienced this when building it for
Debian Experimental.

So this patch bumps the minimum version to 1.4.0.

Change-Id: I672eb3e6f7b6bea6696e62b5553d0f647db1fd26

commit_message:
Use USR2 to create "Guru Meditation Report"

Nova project uses default signal from oslo_reports, and it is USR2 now,
since https://review.openstack.org/223133 is merged.
USR1 just terminates nova-compute.

Change-Id: I96f6c0930c4e6ec2de324ba856499e140f793e8c

returns a 202 for update operation, so this needs a special handler.

commit_message:
archive_policy: disallow to have identical granularities

This disallows having several identical granularities in an archive policy.
This makes sure that when you pick an granularity requested by the user we
can't pick the "wrong" archive, e.g. the longer or shorter one for example.

Change-Id: I937f464d09514741f7ede505b8d7c507ce466c2d

commit_message:
rest: add_measures never raises MetricDoesNotExist

This is not true anymore since Gnocchi has been made asynchronous for
its measures processing.

commit_message:
rest: do not store empty measure set

If the measure set is empty, there's no need to store and process it
later. Just do nothing.

Change-Id: I52f84bc259485c47344fba985d6cc1cd82e599ae
Related-Bug: #1511656

commit_message:
carbonara: handle empty update

If the timeserie passed as argument in update() is empty, just do
nothing.

Change-Id: Ia8ece3bcea39836cd3d3da03b26347d235d7bc97
Closes-Bug: #1511656
