commit_message:
Trivial clean up: do not use plural form in command arguments.

It is a general rule that we don't use plural form for the name of
command arguments. But class DeleteServer() is still using "servers".
So use "server instead".

Change-Id: I2d76de14ec34b88547b9f728b41e9bd93b2a22c5

subject: [Reports] Change template lookup_dirs for ui.utils.get_template()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7369, 'name': 'Sergey Skripnick', 'email': 'sskripnick@mirantis.com', 'username': 'redixin'}, {'_account_id': 10475, 'name': 'Alexander Maretskiy', 'email': 'amaretskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'maretskiy'}, {'_account_id': 11748, 'name': 'Chris St. Pierre', 'email': 'cstpierr@cisco.com', 'username': 'stpierre'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-27 16:47:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[Reports] Change template lookup_dirs for ui.utils.get_template()

rally.ui.utils.get_template() has package distribution directory
in its lookup_dirs - this allowed searching templates in whole
rally project tree.

This is useful in some cases when we just have unpacked rally,
sources for example if we render templates from tests/ci/
on gates. However this lookup directory looks strange after
we install rally, because it becomes pointing to python
packages directory.

This patch changes this lookup directory to system root `/',
therefore rally can get arbitrary template by its absolute
path. This is logical abd gives extra flexibility.

Change-Id: I31cc925a2c592af17bd7411d1c989d1b4ced8b6f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-28 11:48:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[Reports] Change template lookup_dirs for ui.utils.get_template()

rally.ui.utils.get_template() has package distribution directory
in its lookup_dirs - this allowed searching templates in whole
rally project tree.

This is useful in some cases when we just have unpacked rally,
sources for example if we render templates from tests/ci/
on gates. However this lookup directory looks strange after
we install rally, because it becomes pointing to python
packages directory.

This patch changes this lookup directory to system root `/',
therefore rally can get arbitrary template by its absolute
path. This is logical abd gives extra flexibility.

Change-Id: I31cc925a2c592af17bd7411d1c989d1b4ced8b6f
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-10-29 17:27:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[Reports] Change template lookup_dirs for ui.utils.get_template()

ui.utils.get_template() has strange directory in its lookup_dirs:

 os.path.abspath(os.path.join(templates_dir, "..", "..", "..")

This dirctory points on Rally package parent directory and is
used only by gates (to get templates from tests/ci/).

This patch:
  * added optional argument `lookup_dirs' to get_template()
  * if lookup_dirs are not specified, then use `templates_dir'
  * set lookup_dirs to system root for CLI usage, so gates
    can get templates by absolute paths
  * makes proper changes in tests/ci scripts

Change-Id: I31cc925a2c592af17bd7411d1c989d1b4ced8b6f
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-10-30 11:13:07.000000000', 'files': ['rally/ui/utils.py', 'tests/unit/ui/test_utils.py', 'tests/ci/rally-verify.sh', 'tests/ci/rally-gate.py', 'tests/ci/rally-gate.sh'], 'message': '[Reports] Change template lookup_dirs for ui.utils.get_template()

ui.utils.get_template() has strange directory in its lookup_dirs:

 os.path.abspath(os.path.join(templates_dir, "..", "..", "..")

This dirctory points on Rally package parent directory and is
used only by gates (to get templates from tests/ci/).

This patch:
  * replaces this strange directory with system root "/",
    so gates can get template by its absolute path
  * makes proper changes in tests/ci scripts

Change-Id: I31cc925a2c592af17bd7411d1c989d1b4ced8b6f
', 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
[Reports] Change template lookup_dirs for ui.utils.get_template()

ui.utils.get_template() has strange directory in its lookup_dirs:

 os.path.abspath(os.path.join(templates_dir, "..", "..", "..")

This dirctory points on Rally package parent directory and is
used only by gates (to get templates from tests/ci/).

This patch:
  * replaces this strange directory with system root "/",
    so gates can get template by its absolute path
  * makes proper changes in tests/ci scripts

Change-Id: I31cc925a2c592af17bd7411d1c989d1b4ced8b6f

commit_message:
Remove deployment graph config for patching

Patching feature was obsoleted and is not supported anymore.

Delete deployment graph configuration for patching. Delete condition that
yields this configuration when cluster asked for deployment graph.

Closes-bug: 1511499
Change-Id: I7d73aba5b090a5d24729553fdab76bbbaea34ebd

commit_message:
Fix network configuration validator tests

Nailgun tests were failing due to incorrect tests. Previously, they rely
on that default admin (shared) network is created and exists in
database, and when it's not exist (cluster wasn't created by some
previous test, or was removed) - they fail. Moreover, the unexpected
mock object were passed to validator as cluster argument that may
cause further possible failures.

So let's Create a cluster instance and pass it to network configuration
validator, and ensure it works against actual data.

Change-Id: I0c2b5e99d279acfbdca62cd3ceed86ea36b58923
Closes-Bug: #1511725

subject: Python 3: Use six.moves.range
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-30 09:18:33.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/short_id.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/test_hacking.py', 'HACKING.rst', 'magnum/hacking/checks.py'], 'message': 'Python 3: Use six.moves.range

The function `xrange` was renamed to `range` in Python 3.

* Remove `xrange` occurences so that Python 3 tests can pass. Use
  `six.moves.range` instead to get the right function in both cases.
* Add a hacking check to prevent future usage of `xrange`.

Change-Id: I9c33e978238b8b661bff98270c1af5ec629b0d69
Closes-Bug: #1261984
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Python 3: Use six.moves.range

The function `xrange` was renamed to `range` in Python 3.

* Remove `xrange` occurences so that Python 3 tests can pass. Use
  `six.moves.range` instead to get the right function in both cases.
* Add a hacking check to prevent future usage of `xrange`.

Change-Id: I9c33e978238b8b661bff98270c1af5ec629b0d69
Closes-Bug: #1261984

commit_message:
DHCP agent: log when reloading allocations for a new VM port

This will help us to see more clearly if failing DHCP for a new VM -
as seen in failures such as the following traceback from [1] - is
caused by DHCP configuration being too slow, as suggested by the
referenced bug.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/aqua/tempest/tempest/test.py", line 125, in wrapper
    return f(self, *func_args, **func_kwargs)
  File "/home/aqua/tempest/tempest/scenario/test_server_basic_ops_38.py", line 105, in test_server_basicops
    self.verify_ssh()
  File "/home/aqua/tempest/tempest/scenario/test_server_basic_ops_38.py", line 95, in verify_ssh
    private_key=self.keypair['private_key'])
  File "/home/aqua/tempest/tempest/scenario/manager.py", line 310, in get_remote_client
    linux_client.validate_authentication()
  File "/home/aqua/tempest/tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py", line 55, in validate_authentication
    self.ssh_client.test_connection_auth()
  File "/home/aqua/tempest/tempest/common/ssh.py", line 150, in test_connection_auth
    connection = self._get_ssh_connection()
  File "/home/aqua/tempest/tempest/common/ssh.py", line 87, in _get_ssh_connection
    password=self.password)
tempest.exceptions.SSHTimeout: Connection to the 172.17.205.21 via SSH timed out.
User: cirros, Password: None

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/39/194939/19/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron/82a7e58/

Change-Id: I5d77762bf8d4caa2e6f8b3527a30bf80bac62085
Related-Bug: #1453350

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-16 20:34:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add baremetal network for Ironic

This change introduces configuration of new flat network in Neutron.
In case if network settings contains information about 'physnet-ironic'
physnet then Ironic is enabled and 'baremetal' flat network should be
configured in neutron settings.

Also for Ironic should be created 'baremetal' network and subnet in neutron.
This network will used for provision baremetal servers.

User should be able to set cidr and allocation pools for baremetal network.
This change add consideration of parameter 'allocation_pool' in L3 network
data when create new network in Neutron.

Change-Id: Icdb557063bbaf5bb0b5b6ac6c8233e3c3b17e94c
Implemets: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-18 18:05:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add baremetal network for Ironic

commit_message:
[Ironic] Add baremetal network for Ironic

This change introduces configuration of new flat network in Neutron.
In case if network settings contains information about 'physnet-ironic'
physnet then Ironic is enabled and 'baremetal' flat network should be
configured in neutron settings.

Partially Implemets: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic

Change-Id: Icdb557063bbaf5bb0b5b6ac6c8233e3c3b17e94c

commit_message:
Better tolerate deleted OVS ports in OVS agent

This change will not force a resync in the case where a virtual machine is
deleted, and therefore its OVS port deleted, in between the time an RPC
call was made to get the devices and where we make the call to correlate
those devices to vif ports.

Change-Id: Ie55eb69ad7ee177f0cf8ee8fc7fc585fbd0d4a22
Closes-Bug: #1499488
(cherry picked from commit 0a300a2277a583fe28b00db2571982928c752554)

commit_message:
Set geography for O to Catalonia

Barcelona is the largest city in Catalonia which is one of three
"Nationalities" in Spain.

  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nationalities_and_regions_of_Spain
  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalonia

Make Monty naming coordinator for N and O

We know the locations of N and O, so we should pick names.

Follow on patches will fill in geography.
